q1: How do you convert salary to hourly rate?
a1: Divide the annual salary by the total working hours per year. For a standard 40-hour week: Annual Salary ÷ (40 × 52) = Hourly Rate.
q2: How do you convert hourly to annual salary?
a2: Multiply the hourly rate by hours per week, then by weeks per year. For example: /hr × 40 hours × 52 weeks = ,000/year.
q3: What tax rate should I use?
a3: This varies by country and income level. In the US, effective federal tax rates range from 10-37%. Add state taxes for a more accurate estimate.
a4: This calculator shows cash compensation only. Benefits like health insurance, retirement matching, and PTO add significant value on top of salary.
q5: How many work hours in a year?
a5: A standard work year is 2,080 hours (40 hours × 52 weeks). With 2 weeks vacation, it is 2,000 hours. Adjust weeks per year accordingly.
